item.title: No Man's Sky: How to Find Paradise Planets
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Find Paradise Planets In No Man's Sky
    • Look For Planets With Paraffinium Or Star Bulb
    • Travel To The Lush Galaxy

At some point, everyone in their No Man's Sky playthrough wants to find an Earth-like planet to settle down on. From large bodies of water to green trees and almost no hazards, paradise worlds have everything you may want from a peaceful experience in No Man's Sky .

Paradise planets are a subtype of lush planets, and they can be quite a hard find in No Man's Sky . For those looking to discover one, here's a rundown on what you need to know about paradise planets in No Man's Sky and how to find them .

How To Find Paradise Planets In No Man's Sky

Look For Planets With Paraffinium Or Star Bulb

The easiest way to find a paradise planet in No Man's Sky is by using Star Bulb or Paraffinium , which are exclusive to lush planets. If you have collected Paraffinium or Star Bulb during your travels, you can use the Catalogue to locate them.

Here's what to do:

  1. Open the Catalogue & Guide menu.
  2. Find Star Bulb in the Plants tab or Paraffinium in the Raw Materials - Exotic tab.
  3. Select Locate Substance.
  4. Follow the guidance to reach the planet.

This will lead you to a lush planet, but it isn't guaranteed to be a paradise planet. It can also be tropical, humid, overgrown, or any other subtype of lush planet. They often have all the things you may want from an Earth-like planet, but some of them may feature aggressive Sentinels and occasional storms. Even if you don't end up finding a paradise planet, a lush planet of other types may be just as good.

Travel To The Lush Galaxy

No Man's Sky has multiple galaxies that you can travel to from the Galactic Core . The first time you do that is at the end of the main story, where Atlas offers you a choice of where to go. There, you should choose the lush galaxy that has a higher chance of having lush and paradise planets.

Traveling to the Galactic Core takes a lot of warp jumps, but you can also look for Portals and specific coordinates that can shorten your trips. One of the best galaxies to look for lush planets is Eissentam . It's the 10th galaxy in No Man's Sky , which means you're in for a little road trip, unless you know someone who has a base in that galaxy that you can travel to using the Anomaly.

item.title: Pokemon is Releasing New Paldea-Themed Nanoblocks
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon releases new Nanoblock models, including Pawmi, Tandemaus, & Clodsire from the Paldea region.
  • Nanoblocks are micro-sized building blocks similar to LEGO, and popular collector items for fans.
  • Kawada Toys sells the Nanoblock sets for 2420 JPY ($15.60) in Japan only, with no international shipping available.

Pokemon and the Japanese retailer Kawada Toys have released three new pocket monsters into the Nanoblocks line, including Pawmi, Tandemaus, and Clodsire, from the Paldean region. Nanoblocks are similar to LEGO bricks, but they are produced as micro-sized building blocks exclusive to Kawada in Japan and distributed by Ohio Art Company in the United States. First released in 2013, the Nanoblocks have become staple collector pieces within the Pokemon fandom, with three more ready to join the roster.

Pokemon is iconic for its ongoing video game series, including the upcoming Pokemon Legends: Z-A , the popular trading card game currently honoring its Prismatic Evolutions expansion, and the anime, which is presently airing Pokemon Horizons: The Series . However, the Pokemon IP transcends games and television as the franchise’s merchandise presence is varied and lucrative. In addition to Nanoblocks, Pokemon dives into Funko Pop figures, clothes, lifestyle accessories, and much more, including the newly announced life-sized Gardevoir plushie from The Pokemon Center.

Kawada Toys announced that Pawmi, Tandemaus, and Clodsire, were the new Nanoblocks on February 1, 2025, and the models are currently only for sale in Japan without the option for international shipping. Each Nanoblock set includes 400 pieces on average, with varying levels of difficulty depending on the Pokemon’s design, matching the detail found in a Pokemon fan's Groudon Nanoblock. Each Nanoblock costs 2420 JPY ($15.60) and is in stock for Japanese residents only via the Kawada Toys website. For fans outside of Japan, it’s recommended to visit local hobby shops that import these items.

Pokemon Nanoblock Line Welcomes Paldea's Pawmi, Tandemaus, and Clodsire

Pokemon fans have flaunted their impressive Nanoblock collections before, proving the hobby is popular among fans and collectors. In response to the new trio, Twitter users wasted no time by praising the cute additions, with newcomers being tempted to try building them as display items, and another fan called for a Paldean Wooper to be added in the next wave. Additionally, Nanoblock enthusiasts were impressed by the manufacturer’s ability to reproduce each Pokemon’s characteristics in the various blocks on offer.

To celebrate the franchise’s 25th anniversary in 2021, Pokemon unveiled a stack of Nanoblocks featuring OG monsters from the Kanto region, adding to the brand’s 13 series so far. The line already includes the three starters from the beloved Game Boy games, Charmander, Bulbasaur, and Squirtle, alongside the poster monster Pikachu, several Eevee evolutions, and Legendary birds, including Moltres, Articuno, and Zapdos.

item.title: Civ 7's Emergent Narrative System is a Game-Changer
item.description:
Just like with every Civilization game before it, Sid Meier's Civilization 7 shakes up the entire formula with a slew of new features. From splitting up leaders and civilizations to the introduction of army commanders, Civilization 7 will feel quite new to even veterans when the game launches. However, of all the changes made to Civ 7 , one new feature goes off in a completely unique direction: the game's new emergent narrative mechanic.

In a recent interview with Game Rant, Civilization 7 's lead designer Ed Beach shared his thoughts on this new system and why he's excited to see it get into the fanbase's hands. Specifically, he talked about how it builds upon Civilization 6 's gossip system and just what players can expect when they get their hands on it.

Sid Meier's Civilization 7's Emergent Narratives Is A Game-Changer

Civilization 7's Emergent Narratives Stem From Civ 6's Gossip

The idea behind this new emergent narrative system came after Firaxis took a long look at Civilization 6 's gossip system. That system would notify players about various things happening in the world, like wonders that were being built or discoveries that were made. While that did give them better insight into the world around them, Beach felt like it was ultimately a failure and wanted to craft something better.

"That system we found in Sid Meier's Civilization 6 was just probably a little bit too noisy. There was just too much churn there for the players to really be able to engage with it and pay attention to it. There were some interesting tidbits in there, but they kind of got missed by players. We took that out for Sid Meier's Civilization 7, b ut what we did is the same technology that informed the game systems about what was going on in the game world got fed into our new narrative system."

Now, instead of hearing gossip, things happening in Civilization 7 's world build into these new narrative events. For example, if a city is flooded multiple times, there may be an event that is triggered to go along with that. Some can be as simple as that, while others can be triggered by massive chains of stories. With each playthrough, there will be a slew of new events depending upon what is going on, making it so that no two games are alike.

The Emergent Narratives Could Lead to Something Special

These emergent narrative events make for a fantastic new addition to the Civilization formula. Not only can they add some unexpected excitement to a playthrough, but their addition could also give the game endless replayability. According to Beach, Firaxis cannot wait to see what players do with it.

"We actually can track in our new game engine how many times certain stories are shown to players, so it's going to be really interesting, right after our game launches, to figure out if people are seeing these complex chains of stories. It's definitely been a pretty interesting journey to get all that in and working, but we're really excited about the potential, not only for what we can do with it to further expand the experience for Sid Meier's Civilization 7 players, but also what the mod community is going to be able to do with it.

The studio is able to actually track these events, so it will be able to see which ones are happening and how they are happening. Additionally, Civilization modders will be able to take the concept and run with it, adding a slew of unique events to the experience. Because of that, players may be in for some wild stories from both Firaxis and the community as the years go by. And if the system is a hit, it may be built upon for even more years after that.

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth: Best Materia To Level Up First
item.description:
Materia is one of the most interesting magic systems in the series. It is the biggest gameplay mechanic that has carried over from Final Fantasy 7 . It did not change on how it was used in Final Fantasy 7 Remake and its usage hasn't changed in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . Players can buy or acquire Materia through side quests, and there are five types in all: Magic, Support, Complete, Summon, and Command.

They can all be useful in battle from elemental Materia, which can cast spells like Fire to Complete Materia to boost stats like HP. It’s a lot to take in for Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth novices, but thankfully, there is a guide. From Kalm to Junon, these are the best Materia players should focus on acquiring and leveling up as soon as possible.

Updated on February 4th, 2025 by Joshua Leeds: There are a lot of Materia in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth, and you'll quickly get a bunch even during Chapter 2 when you first take control of the main party. This list has been updated to include additional Materia as you're able to equip many on each party member right away and a lot of Materia will need to be leveled up throughout many chapters of the game, so it's best to start as soon as possible.

13 AP Up Materia

Found In The Mythril Mines When Playing As Barret & Red XIII

An honorable mention for this list that is still worth putting on it is the AP Up Materia. While this materia can't be leveled up, it does double the amount of AP earned by linked Materia, and it should be linked to any Materia found on this list.

Linked Materia is represented when two Materia slots are connected in the menu, and only one Materia can be linked to this one at a time. There are only a few AP Up Materia in the game, and the first one is found in the Mythril Mine. Once you get this Materia, you should take advantage of it and always have it equipped throughout the rest of the game.

12 Chakra Materia

Starting Materia On Tifa

The Chakra Materia is a healing option though it's more limited in that it can only heal the caster. It does have the bonus of also curing poison and will heal more the lower your health is at. While this may seem like a limited Materia, it's best used when left on Tifa.

Tifa and other frontline fighters will almost be in the thick of fighting, and can also quickly charge up ATB. While this Materia won't be a good party-wide healing option, it is very useful to have on a character who will more often find themselves low on health. It can also free up backline magic users to hit weaknesses with powerful magic instead of always focusing on healing.

11 The Five Basic Magic Materia

Fire/Ice/Lightning/Wind/Healing Materia (Available In Shops Starting In Kalm)

Players can’t go wrong in mastering five of the most basic Materia in the game including Fire Materia Ice Materia, Lightning Materia, and Wind Materia. Those are all elemental-based Materia which can be used to exploit enemy weaknesses in battle like by using Aero.

The fifth notable Materia is called Healing Materia, and it can create spells like Cure to heal the party. The nice thing about all five of these Materia pieces is that the party begins with them all plus duplicates can be purchased at shops starting in Kalm which is in Chapter 2 of Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth .

10 Fire And Ice Materia

Purchase From Chadley

Fire and Ice Materia feels like a carryover from Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 which allowed players to fuse Materia in a variety of odd combos. It can be purchased from Chadley in the Grasslands area of the game once players get enough points from World Intel side quests.

The nice thing about this Materia, besides saving a slot on armor or a weapon, is that Ice and Fire spells also come with status effects. Ice can freeze enemies, for example, which makes sense from a logical standpoint. Lightning and Wind Materia is another combo from Chadley, but that’s in his Junon shop.

9 Elemental Materia

Obtained Through Battle Intel: Conqueror of the Skies

Elemental Materia can turn any weapon into an elemental nightmare for enemies. For example, combining Elemental Materia and Ice Materia on one of Tifa’s gloves will make her hits strike with Ice power. This is great against enemies weak to Ice but bad for enemies that can absorb Ice attacks.

Elemental Materia can also absorb that attached element’s power for heroes, so it is both an offensive and defensive Materia which can be acquired through one of Chadley’s simulation courses, Battle Intel: Conqueror of the Skies.

8 Magic Efficiency Materia

Purchase From Chadley

Magic Efficiency Materia can be purchased from Chadley too but in the Junon region. This is a great one to level up fast because it will reduce the linked Materia’s MP cost like the aforementioned Fire and Ice Materia. Creating combos like this for the party will be the key to victory concerning Materia in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth .

This will allow players to use more magic in battle as stat numbers can be low toward the start of the game, unlike HP, which is genuinely high. It can be a pain to use items like Ethers in battle, too.

7 Assess Materia

Cloud Starts With It

The Assess Materia used to be called Sense in the PS1 version of Final Fantasy 7 . It allowed players to scan enemies for HP and weaknesses, which could be especially helpful during boss fights. The Assess Materia works virtually the same, except that once leveled up, it can scan all enemies on screen.

Plus, every enemy that is scanned can be accessed during battle with the PS5’s touchpad. It's crucial to always assess powerful enemies and bosses, as trying to guess their weaknesses will usually end with you hitting immunities and wasting ATB and MP. This Materia can help a lot with Chadley’s World Intel Quests, and Cloud begins with it.

6 Prayer Materia

Aerith Starts With It

This Command Materia is in Aerith’s possession at the start, which makes sense. The Prayer Materia can heal all party members in battle although only for a little amount until it gets leveled up. Still, it’s good in the early game because players can’t get Magnify Materia until Chapter 9 when Cait Sith joins the crew.

Magnify Materia can make any spell target multiple allies or foes in battle. So, a good combo for this would be Magnify Materia plus Healing Materia, but that is a tip for another day.

5 Enemy Skill Materia

Obtained Through Biological Intel: Know Thine Enemy

Enemy Skill Materia was like the Blue Mage equivalent in Final Fantasy 7 . In the original version, players could learn specific enemy attacks if they were attacked and equipped with this Materia. In Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , players will need to learn enemy attacks through Chadley’s simulator.

This is also how they will gain the Materia in the first place via the mission, Biological Intel: Know Thine Enemy. Unlike other iterations, this version of Enemy Skill Materia will boost stats upon leveling up like increasing HP.

4 Auto-Cast Materia

Purchased From Chadley In The Grasslands

Auto-Cast makes your AI companions much more useful in battle, as they will automatically use ATB and MP to use the Materia that is linked to this one. This is incredibly useful on a magic user who is hitting a boss' weakness, as that's all you'll want them to focus on for the fight.

While you can jump around and use each party member's personally, this can usually draw out fights or make you jump away from a character you need to focus on using effectively. While the limits for this Materia seem limited, when it is used right, it's incredibly helpful.

3 HP Up Materia

Obtained Through Combat Training: Beginner’s Hall

Speaking of increasing HP through Enemy Skill Materia, HP Up Materia will do that too but better. Every level will increase the percentage of HP for a character, and it takes a long time to max out at five stars.

The first taste can be achieved through Chadley’s Combat Training: Beginner’s Hall mission but HP Up Materia will become available in shops eventually. MP Up Materia is the rarer of the two in the early game, which should also be leveled up as soon as possible to allow characters to cast more spells in battle.

2 MP Up Materia

Get One From The Combat Trainer & The Mythril Mines

While it may seem like HP is the more important resource to have on a party member, it's actually usually MP. Spell casters will drain through MP in a longer fight, and when using powerful spells that hit a weakness you won't want them to stop.

This Materia is a percentage increase, making it more efficient every time your characters level up. Stacking multiple leveled-up MP Up Materia can also have you easily double a character's MP, giving them a seemingly endless pool of MP to never stop casting spells.

1 First Strike Materia

Obtained Through Grasslands Battle Intel: Horror on the Range

First Strike Materia will fill up the ATB gauge for a character at the start of battle. Normally, the ATB gauge increases as players attack enemies. Starting with a bit filled, or a whole bar completely, will allow players to get the edge on enemies.

For example, using Assess at the start on a new enemy or boss can make all the difference. The first available piece can be found via the mission, Grasslands Battle Intel: Horror on the Range.
